alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; North Snowy Range Foothills; South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: High Wind Watch issued December 31 at 1:28PM MST until January 02 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...West winds 35 to 45 MPH with gusts up to 70 MPH likely. * WHERE...Northern Snowy Range Foothills, including Arlington and Elk Mountain. Southwest Platte County, including Bordeaux, and the Interstate 80 Summit and Foothills. * WHEN...Saturday evening through late Sunday evening. Strong winds may continue into early next week for a few areas. * IMPACTS...Mainly to transportation. Strong cross winds will be hazardous to light weight and high profile vehicles, including campers and tractor trailers. Areas of blowing snow will develop as the winds increase, resulting in significantly reduced visibilities and drifting snow on area roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Significant blowing and drifting snow is possible this weekend. Depending on how much snow falls Friday and Friday night, visibilities may be reduced below one half mile with snow drifting on area roadways. Travelers are urged to monitor forecasts and road conditions.
info.instruction: A High Wind Watch means there is the potential for a hazardous high wind event. Sustained winds of at least 40 mph...or gusts of 58 mph or stronger may occur. Continue to monitor the latest forecasts.

area.areaDesc: Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; North Snowy Range Foothills; South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills
